abstract: Federal Aviation Administration says Boeing has agreed to pay $12 million for not meeting deadline to submit service instructions that would allow airlines to cut risk of fuel tank explosions, among other violations.
lead_paragraph: Boeing agreed to the settle for failing to meet a deadline to submit service instructions that would enable airlines cut the risk of fuel tank explosions, the F.A.A. said.

headline.main: Boeing to Pay $12 Million for Missing Safety Deadline
headline.print_headline: Boeing to Pay $12 Million for Missing Safety Deadline

snippet: Boeing agreed to the settle for failing to meet a deadline to submit service instructions that would enable airlines cut the risk of fuel tank explosions, the F.A.A. said.
